revised_title: Radium Rays and Their Effect on the Sensation of Light and Visual Purple
tldr: The authors investigated the sensation of light produced by radium rays and its relation to the visual purple. They found that the sensation is due to the (β and γ rays, which cause fluorescence in the tissues of the eyeball, mainly the cornea and lens. The sensation is not directly related to the visual purple, as exposure to radium rays did not bleach the visual purple in frog or rabbit retinas.
